main event: A round object, the size of a basketball and varying in color from red to green to amber, was observed flying south-southeast (SSE) for approximately 40 minutes on multiple occasions in March 1956.
interesting points: The object was observed on the nights of March 4, 5, and 8, 1956, in the same position and with similar characteristics., At least four sources reported the sighting, all describing similar features of the object., Witness descriptions included the object changing brightness and flickering colors., The sighting led to numerous theories and investigations, with some believing it was a man-made satellite or the star Sirius., The object was reported to be solid, and several witnesses confirmed its colors shifted at regular intervals.
witness description: The witnesses were varied, including civilians, a housewife, a patrolman, and an engineer, most of whom had a high school diploma or higher, with some having technical backgrounds.
